title: Setback for Hindu monk Chinmoy Krishna Das as Bangladesh court rejects bail plea - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bangladesh Court Denies Bail to Hindu Monk Chinmoy Krishna Das

Date: January 02, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A Chattogram court in Bangladesh has denied bail to Chinmoy Krishna Das, a former ISKCON monk, during a tightly secured hearing.

  • The court hearing lasted about 30 minutes with arguments presented by both sides.
  • A team of 11 Supreme Court lawyers represented Chinmoy Krishna Das.
  • His bail plea was rejected by Metropolitan Sessions judge Md Saiful Islam.
  • Chinmoy faces sedition charges for allegedly raising a saffron flag above Bangladesh's national flag.
  • His arrest on November 25 led to protests and clashes resulting in a lawyer's death.
  • Additional arrests of fellow monks occurred amid the unrest.
  • The Indian government expressed concern over the situation in Bangladesh.
“We will move for Chinmoy in the court for his bail.” - Lawyer Apurba Kumar Bhattacharjee

The decision by the Chattogram court highlights ongoing tensions in Bangladesh regarding minority rights and protests against extremism.
newTitle: Bangladesh Court Denies Bail to Hindu Monk Chinmoy Krishna Das

title: ​8 Beautiful Unseen Deep Space Pictures Captured By NASA​ - Times Now
summary:
8 Beautiful Unseen Deep Space Pictures Captured By NASA

Date: Jan 2, 2025 | Source: Times Now

This article showcases eight stunning images captured by NASA, revealing the breathtaking beauty and complexity of deep space. Each image highlights various celestial phenomena as observed by the Hubble Space Telescope.

  • Arp-Madore 2339-661: Interacting galaxies that highlight complex gravitational interactions.
  • XZ Tauri: A multiple star system expelling hot gas bubbles, showcasing star formation.
  • From Dim To Dazzling: A vibrant star-forming region within the Milky Way.
  • A Spiral Star Factory: The spiral galaxy NGC 5668 known for its star formation.
  • Stellar Ensemble In NGC 6357: A star cluster that ionizes parts of the emission nebula.
  • Stellar Remnant SNR 0509-68.7: A supernova remnant closely studied by astronomers.
  • NGC 6302: A planetary nebula, known as the butterfly nebula, formed by a fading star.
  • AFGL 5180: A star-forming region providing insights into solar system formation.
"These images not only mesmerize but also promote an understanding of the universe we inhabit." - TN Tech Desk

In conclusion, these breathtaking images taken by NASA serve as a reminder of the vast beauty and complexity of the universe, inspiring curiosity and further exploration.
newTitle: 8 Beautiful Unseen Deep Space Pictures Captured By NASA

Magnus Carlsen defends Blitz title, shares it with Nepomniachtchi; Wenjun Champion in Women’s section - Sportstar
summary:
Magnus Carlsen defends Blitz title, beats Nepomniachtchi in final; Wenjun Champion in Women’s section

Date: January 1, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

In a historic conclusion to the World Blitz Championship 2024 on Wall Street, New York, reigning champion Magnus Carlsen shared the title with Ian Nepomniachtchi after a series of draws in sudden-death play. Despite Carlsen's initial wins, Nepomniachtchi's resilience forced a tie, leading to an unprecedented decision of shared victory.

  • Carlsen and Nepomniachtchi ended the game tied at 2-2, resulting in three drawn games in sudden-death.
  • This match mirrored the 2021 Classical World Championship, enhancing its historical significance.
  • Carlsen has now won eight Blitz titles and 18 major championships overall.
  • Ju Wenjun claimed the Women's World Blitz Championship by defeating Lei Tingjie.
  • India’s R. Vaishali advanced in the tournament but was defeated by Wenjun in the semifinals.
— International Chess Federation (@FIDE_chess) January 1, 2025

This championship showcases the high-level competition in chess and the continuing evolution of the game.
newTitle: Magnus Carlsen Share Blitz Title with Ian Nepomniachtchi; Ju Wenjun Wins Women's Section

title: Eclipse, Meteors, Auroras, Supermoon in 2025 - Deccan Chronicle
summary:
Celestial Events to Look Forward to in 2025: Eclipses, Supermoons, and More

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: AP News

The year 2025 will feature a series of spectacular astronomical events including eclipses, supermoons, and a parade of planets. Stargazers can expect multiple opportunities to witness these cosmic occurrences, enhancing the viewing experience for enthusiasts.

  • January will kick off with a six-planet parade visible for an extended period.
  • The first lunar eclipse will occur on March 14, followed by a partial solar eclipse two weeks later.
  • Three supermoons are expected in October, November, and December, with the closest occurring in November.
  • A line-up of six planets will be visible around mid-January.
  • Geomagnetic storms may lead to enhanced displays of the northern and southern lights throughout the year.
  • Popular meteor showers such as the Perseids and Geminids will peak in August and December.
“People should go out and see them sometime during the next many weeks. I certainly will,” said Bruce Betts, chief scientist at the Planetary Society.

In conclusion, astronomy enthusiasts have much to look forward to in 2025, with various celestial events expected to delight and inspire star watchers around the globe.
newTitle: Celestial Events to Look Forward to in 2025: Eclipses, Supermoons, and More

title: Why do women have high pain tolerance? Is it a healthy trait? - The Times of India
summary:
Why do women have high pain tolerance? Is it a healthy trait?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Women possess a remarkable capacity to endure various forms of pain, with their pain tolerance being influenced by biological, hormonal, and psychological factors.

  • Dr. Astha Dayal highlights that women's pain tolerance may be linked to evolutionary adaptations, particularly regarding childbirth.
  • Hormonal aspects, especially estrogen, play a significant role in pain perception and tolerance.
  • Women are encouraged to address pain, as ignoring it can lead to negative health outcomes.
  • Societal conditioning often leads women to view pain as an expected part of life, which can discourage open discussions about discomfort.
  • Dr. Sameer Malhotra notes the subjective nature of pain and how it can be influenced by various factors, including social expectations.
  • Acknowledging pain is viewed as an act of self-care rather than weakness, promoting better health outcomes.
“Pain is often the body’s first alert to something amiss.”

In conclusion, while women's high pain tolerance can be seen as resilience, it is essential to recognize and address pain appropriately to maintain overall health and well-being.
newTitle: Why Women Have High Pain Tolerance: Insights and Implications

title: Places of worship law: SC to hear AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi’s plea - The Hindu
summary:
Supreme Court to Hear Owaisi's Plea on Places of Worship Law

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Supreme Court has agreed to consider the plea of AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi regarding the implementation of the 1991 places of worship law aimed at maintaining the religious character of places as they existed on August 15, 1947.

  • The Court will tag Owaisi's plea with pending cases on February 17, 2025.
  • AIMIM's plea follows a prior order restraining courts from hearing new suits on reclaiming religious places.
  • The 1991 law prohibits the conversion of places of worship.
  • Owaisi's plea seeks effective enforcement of the law amid concerns over court-ordered surveys of mosques.
“We will tag this,” the CJI said regarding the plea.

Owaisi's call for action reflects ongoing tensions surrounding religious site claims in India, emphasizing the need for legal clarity and enforcement of existing regulations.
newTitle: Supreme Court to Hear Owaisi's Plea on Places of Worship Law

title: Supreme Court to hear AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi's plea on places of worship law - The Hindu
summary:
Supreme Court to Hear Asaduddin Owaisi's Plea on Places of Worship Law

Date: January 02, 2025
Source: The Hindu

The Supreme Court is set to hear AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi's plea regarding the 1991 places of worship law, which mandates maintaining the religious character of places as they were on August 15, 1947. The hearing follows a recent Supreme Court ruling that halted fresh litigations against the law.

  • Owaisi filed his plea on December 17, 2024, through advocate Fuzail Ahmad Ayyubi.
  • The 1991 law prohibits changing the religious character of places of worship as they existed in 1947.
  • A recent Supreme Court order restrained courts from taking on new suits regarding the religious character of several mosques.
  • Cases concerning various religious sites, including Gyanvapi, Shahi Idgah, and Shahi Jama Masjid, have been stalled pending the court's review.
  • The Muslim side has filed pleas for the law's strict enforcement to maintain communal peace.
“The petitions challenging the law were filed with 'mischievous intent' to facilitate lawsuits against these religious sites.”

This upcoming hearing may tag Owaisi's plea with existing cases regarding the law's implementation and its implications for communal harmony.
newTitle: Supreme Court to Hear Asaduddin Owaisi's Plea on Places of Worship Law

title: Quordle Answer for Today (January 2); Hints, Answers & How to Play? - Gizbot
summary:
Quordle Answer for Today (January 2); Hints, Answers & How to Play?

Updated: Thursday, January 2, 2025, 9:32 [IST]

Quordle is a unique word game where players solve four puzzles at once. For those looking for today's (Quordle 1074) hints and answers, you can find them below.

Quordle 1074 Hints For January 2, 2025

Starting Letters: U, S, D, I
Ending Letters: Y, E, T, O

  • Word 1 - Make or become united
  • Word 2 - Make a solemn statement or promise undertaking to do something
  • Word 3 - A place for the storage of large quantities of equipment
  • Word 4 - An introduction

Quordle 1074 Answers For January 2, 2025

  • Word 1 - UNIFY
  • Word 2 - SWORE
  • Word 3 - DEPOT
  • Word 4 - INTRO

How to Play Quordle?

Start Quordle by selecting any five-letter word. Each grid will display guessed letters in different colours indicating their position or relevance to the target words.

Green indicates the correct letter and position, yellow means it is in the word but not in the right spot, and grey shows it isn't part of any of the words. Use these colour-coded hints to inform your guesses.

Quordle is both a challenge and enjoyable, so take your time and visit Merriam-Webster's website regularly for updates.
newTitle: Quordle Answer for January 2, 2025: Hints and Solutions

title: South Korea police search Jeju Air, airport operator over fatal plane crash - Reuters
summary:
South Korea Police Search Jeju Air, Airport Operator Over Fatal Plane Crash

Date: January 2, 2024 | Source: Reuters

On January 2, South Korean police raided Jeju Air and Muan International Airport as part of their investigation into a tragic plane crash that killed 179 people.

  • Police are searching for operation and maintenance data related to the aircraft.
  • The cockpit voice recorder's data has been converted to audio files for analysis.
  • Experts raised concerns over a rigid structure near the runway that may have contributed to the crash.
"This rigid structure proved catastrophic when the skidding aircraft made impact," said Najmedin Meshkati, engineering professor.

The incident has drawn widespread attention and questions regarding aviation safety protocols in South Korea.
newTitle: South Korea Police Investigate Fatal Jeju Air Plane Crash

title: New Epidemic In China? Fact-Checking Videos Showing 'Overwhelmed Hospitals' - Times Now
summary:
New Epidemic In China? Fact-Checking Videos Showing 'Overwhelmed Hospitals'

Publication Date: Not provided | Source: Times Now

Several social media users have falsely claimed that hospitals in China are overwhelmed due to a new epidemic, but these claims lack any credible support.

  • Accusations of a new epidemic spreading rapidly in China are not backed by official sources.
  • No statements have been issued by the Chinese health department or WHO confirming these claims.
  • People are sharing videos of crowded hospitals, but this does not indicate an epidemic.
  • WHO has urged China to investigate and share data regarding the origins of COVID-19.
“There is no information to back up the claim that China has declared a state of emergency over epidemics overwhelming the hospitals and crematoriums in the country.”

This misinformation highlights the importance of verifying claims made on social media before accepting them as fact.
newTitle: New Epidemic In China? Fact-Checking Videos Showing 'Overwhelmed Hospitals'

title: Tesla Cybertruck explodes outside Trump hotel in Las Vegas, killing one - The Hindu
summary:
Tesla Cybertruck Explosion Outside Trump Hotel in Las Vegas Claims One Life

Publication Date: January 02, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

At least one person was killed and seven wounded when a Tesla Cybertruck exploded outside a hotel belonging to US President-elect Donald Trump in Las Vegas, police reported.

  • The explosion occurred on January 1, 2025, at the Trump International Hotel.
  • Authorities are investigating any potential links between this explosion and a truck attack in New Orleans on the same day.
  • The explosion was termed an isolated incident by local law enforcement.
  • The Tesla contained gasoline, camping fuel, and fireworks, which contributed to the explosion.
  • Elon Musk stated that the explosion was caused by fireworks or a bomb in the vehicle, not a fault of the vehicle itself.
  • The explosion did not damage the hotel’s glass doors, as much of the blast went upward.
“Thus far, there's nothing to report on that score.” - President Joe Biden regarding connections to New Orleans attack.

The explosion has raised concerns about security and potential terror links, but authorities have found no solid evidence connecting the incidents.
newTitle: Tesla Cybertruck Explosion Outside Trump Hotel in Las Vegas Claims One Life
